datafield.subfield: From the Llyfr Coch o Hergest, and other ancient Welsh manuscripts,
with an English translation and notes by Lady Charlotte E. Guest.

translated by Charlotte Guest ; with illustrations by Jo Nathan ; and revised with footnotes by Owen Edwards.

collected and described by Lady Charlotte Schreiber.
In 1891 Lady Schreiber presented her collection to the British museum. A catalogue, compiled by Lionel Cust, assistant in the Department of prints and drawings, was printed in 1893.

Barzas-Breiz. Chants populaires de la Bretagne, recueillis et publiés avec une traduction franðcaise, des arguments, des notes et les mélodies originales,
par Th. Hersart de La Villemarqué ...
Copies of the 1st edition exist in which v. 2, dated 1840, is called 2nd edition (cf. Brit. mus. catalogue).
"Melodies bretonnes": 12 pages at end of v. 2.
Full name: Vicomte de, Théodore Claude Henri Hersart, La Villemarqué.
LC copy has tipped-in letter and dedication from the author to Lady Charlotte Guest, dated 18 Sept 1840.

confidences of a collector of ceramics & antiques throughout Britain, France, Holland, Belgium, Spain, Portugal, Turkey, Austria & Germany from the year 1869 to 1885,
ed. by her son, Montague J. Guest, with annotations by Egan Mew, illustrated by upwards of one hundred plates, including eight in colour & one in photogravure...
In 1884, Lady Schreiber presented 2000 pieces of English pottery, from her collection, to the South Kensington museum, as a memorial to her husband, Charles Schreiber.
